thread.title_full: Walker Art Center to hold Todd Haynes film retrospective - CT Post

title: Walker Art Center to hold Todd Haynes film retrospective - CT Post
text: Walker Art Center to hold Todd Haynes film retrospective Published 5:02 am, Saturday, October 10, 2015 MINNEAPOLIS (AP) — The Walker Art Center honors director Todd Haynes with a retrospective next month. "Todd Haynes: 20 Years of Killer Films " runs Nov. 5-14 in the Walker Cinema. The retrospective opens with a free screening of Haynes' latest film, "Carol," on Nov. 5. Based on a Patricia Highsmith novel, "Carol" explores a love affair between two women — played by Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara — in the 1950s. Other Haynes' films to be shown include "I'm Not There," which uses six actors to portray Bob Dylan ; "Far From Heaven," starring Julianne Moore as a '50s housewife facing a marital crisis; the glam-rock drama "Velvet Goldmine"; and "Safe," about a suburban homemaker (Moore) who develops chemical sensitivity. Haynes appears for a dialogue with Scott Foundas of Amazon Studios on Nov. 6.
